result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Alvin J Sanapaw was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvin J Sanapaw

02:23 Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw appears and attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure appear via Zoom Video.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is in agreement with the proposal submitted by DOC. Atty. Campshure objects to residence location as defendant would like to live with family. Court swears in Wendy Stone. Atty. Campshure questions witness. No cross by State. Court approves conditional release plan as proposed.
Review hearing on July 29, 2020 at 02:15 pm.

11:40 AM Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Both appear by phone.  Bela Alexander Ballo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Conditional release plan discussion.  Remarks by case worker re: group home placement.  Questions by Atty. Campshure and Atty. Ballo.  Review hearing scheduled for July 29, 2020 at 02:15 pm.
Review hearing on June 29, 2020 at 11:15 am.

01:30 pm Conditional release hearing Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw appeared by zoom means. Prosecuting Atty Laura Nelson appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report of 4-15 reviewed.  
Doctor Taylor joins the hearing via zoom.  Questioned by ADA Nelson.  Questioned by Atty Campshure.  
Judge will authorize for conditional release planning.  
  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2020 at 03:30 pm.
Cover letter for Conditional Release Petition
Judge faxed copy requested to Mendota

2:00 p.m.  Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel Jeremy Campshure.  State appears by Catharine White.  Dr. Leslie Taylor is sworn and testifies for the State.  Court accepts witness as an expert and is questioned by Attny White.  Initially believed based on defendant's progress could be released to community supervision, but after reviewing more recent reports from Mendota, changed her mind about release.  Cross-exam by Attny Campshure.  Redirect, recross, redirect.  Court questions Doctor about lenth of time to become stable again.  Defense has no witnesses.  Brief arguments by Attny White and Campshure.  Court denies defendant's request for conditional release at this time on both his files.
Order for Examination - NG by reason of mental disease

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Conditional release hearing.  Dr Taylor sworn in and testifies.  Questioned by ADA White.  Cross exam by Atty Campshure.  Judicial notice taken of reports.  State asks for denial of release.  Defense asks for court to grant release.  Court rules:  progress is insufficient to develop a plan for release.  Motion is denied.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with Attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court informs the parties the report has been reviewed. Both Atty.'s inform the court that they also have reviewed the report. Dr. Leslie Taylor sworn (via telephone) & questioned by Atty. White. Cross exam by Atty. Campshure. Atty. White provides  her closing statements to the court. Atty. Campshure provides his closing statements to the court. Ruling - Request is denied by the court.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Catharine D. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is still pursuing his request for conditional release.  Dr. Leslie Taylor appears by phone, is sworn and testifies regarding her report.  Cross exam by Attny Campshure.  Court questions Dr. Taylor about defendant's medications.  Arguments by DA and defense.  Court denies defendant's request for conditional release at this time and signs the order for subsequent placement.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jeremey Michael Campshure.  Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Leslie T. who prepared the report regarding conditional release is present by phone and questioned by Attny Campshure and Attny White.  She does not belief defendant is ready for conditional release.  Based on Dr.'s recommendation nad the standards necessary to approve conditional release, the Court does not find the defendant appropriate for conditional release at this time and will require medication be administered as necessary.
from Mendota on defendant's petition for conditional release

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in custody. Catharine White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  MOTION TO WITHDRAW PLEA:  Atty Groh summarizes motion 1) DE was unaware of elements of charges 2) Court unable to cite factual basis.  ADA White calls Atty SW to testifiy.  SW addresses Court, only way he can testifiy is if DE gives permission.  DE permits testimony.  SW sworn & testifies.  Ex. 1-PLQ signed by DE.  Objection - Relevance-Sustained.  Cross-exam.  Objection - Counsel is testifying - sustained.  ADA White moves to admit Ex. 1. No objection, Atty Groh notes Ex. has previously been highlighted.  Court questions witness.  Atty Groh request recess to confirm w/client.  Recess 11:35 AM-11:38 AM.   DE sworn by Court and testifies.  Cross-exam.  Objection - Motion speaks for itself - sustained.  Cross-exam. Closing statements:  Atty Groh - re: part 1 of motion, requests DE be allowed to withdraw plea, part 2-cites case law.  ADA White - creditable testimony is that of SW, believes DE knew what he was doing at the time, requests Court deny motion.  Atty Groh -  specific claim - DE did not know the elements of burglary.  Court finds colique was deficient, Dr. Galli reviewed basis idea w/DE, reviews transcript of original plea hearing on record, finds DE was not lacking in knowing the elements, DENIES MOTION.  Atty Groh to draft order.
Order of the Court of Appeals that the time for filing the NOA or post-conviction motion is extended to 11-21-16.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is the date set for arguments on how much time the defendant should be institutionalized.  DA requests 14 1/2 years.  Arguments by defense for a minimul amount.  Would like time served.  Court orders 6 years with credit of 254 days.  Appeal rights.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report reviewed by State and the defense.  Sally Fleischmann Forensic supervisor sworn in and testifies.  Makes recommendation for Institutionalization.  Cross Exam by Atty Weerts.  Judge makes a finding that Atty Weerts pointing out in the statute.  Defendants father sworn in and testifies.  Both attorneys question Mr. Sanapaw.  Defendant addresses the court.  Attorneys each make arguments.  Judge finds recommendation of agency logical.  All standards are met.  Institutional Care and medical treatment required. No voting, no firearms.

Defendant Alvin J Sanapaw in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report from Dr. Galli received.  Atty Weerts requests Court finds NG  due to Mental Disease or defect, believes report is for both this case and 15CF248.  ADA White will stipulate to NGI plea.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NGI plea to Count 1. Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  Advises DE of voting & firearms rights Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE  guilty NGI.  ADA Moves to DRI Count 2, requests DE remain in custody.  Review hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Arguments for a reduction in bond.  DA objects and states why.  Bond will continue.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
